medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric pain and nonbilious emesis for 3 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed epigastric pain and nonbilious emesis after eating pizza and consuming two alcoholic beverages the night prior to presentation. The pain progressively worsened, with the last episode of emesis occurring the day before presentation. The patient has not had a bowel movement since the morning of presentation. Additionally, the patient experienced chills and sweats without fevers.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension diagnosed in childhood; not on medications.
